name: p-methoxy-g-phenylbutyric acid
Reason: The compound p-methoxy-g-phenylbutyric acid consists of several functional groups that influence its melting point. Here's the quantitative consideration for each of them: - Basic phenyl group: Benzene has a benchmark melting point of 5.5°C. - Methoxy group (-OCH3) attached to the benzene typically increases the melting point due to additional van der Waals forces and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20°C. - Butyric acid side chain (CCCC(=O)O) generally elevates the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the possibility of hydrogen bonding, approximated at +40°C. However, since it is attached to the para position, it does not cause as much steric hindrance, which would lower the melting point if it were otherwise. Combining these effects yields an estimated melting point for p-methoxy-g-phenylbutyric acid.
